api

Interface ModifiableNeighborGraph<S>

  • Type Parameters:
    S - The vertex type on which the graph structure is defined.
    All Superinterfaces:
    NeighborGraph<S>
    All Known Implementing Classes:
    BreadthFirstNeighborGraphBuilder, IndexedNeighborGraphBuilder, NeighborGraphBuilder

    public interface ModifiableNeighborGraph<S>
extends NeighborGraph<S>
    Interface for NeighborGraph builder classes that includes methods for adding vertices to the graph, and for joining pairs of vertices.
    Author:
    pdokos

    • Method Summary

      Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      boolean addVertex(S s)
      Method for adding an object of type S to the vertex set of the graph.
      void finish()
      Method for signaling the completion of graph construction, and for executing any post-construction processes.
      boolean join(S src, S tgt)
      Method for joining two vertices of the graph.

      • Methods inherited from interface api.NeighborGraph

        containsVertex, getNeighborsOf, getNumberOfEdges, getNumberOfVertices, getVertices, hasEdgeJoining

    • Method Detail

      • addVertex

        boolean addVertex(S s)
        Method for adding an object of type S to the vertex set of the graph.
        Parameters:
        s - any element of S.
        Returns:
        true if the graph does not already contain a vertex equivalent to s, and s was successfully added to the vertex set of the graph.

      • join

        boolean join(S src,
           S tgt)
        Method for joining two vertices of the graph.
        Parameters:
        src - any element of S.
        tgt - any element of S.
        Returns:
        true if a new edge was successfully added to the graph.

      • finish

        void finish()
        Method for signaling the completion of graph construction, and for executing any post-construction processes.
